sen.j: 伏見区（ふしみく）は、京都市を構成する11区のひとつである。
sen.e: The Fushimi Ward is one of the 11 Wards that comprise Kyoto City.
Fushimi Ward is one of the 11 Wards that constitute Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: "The" is not required with the name of a ward.
sen.e: Fushimi Ward is one of the eleven wards that constitute Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。

sen.j: 京都市内屈指の住宅地で11行政区中最大の人口を擁する。
sen.e: It is the most popular residential area with the largest population of all the 11 administrative wards of Kyoto City.
It is the most popular residential area in Kyoto City, with the largest population of all the 11 administrative wards.
sen.cmt: 後半を書き換えました。
sen.e: It is the most popular residential area in Kyoto City, with the largest population of all the eleven administrative wards.
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。

sen.j: 伏見城城下町の伝統を受け継ぐ商業拠点である一方、京都市中心部や大阪市方面へのベッドタウンとしての性格をもつ。
sen.e: It is characterized as not only a commercial center that carries on the tradition of castle town of Fuishim-jo Castle but also a commuter town of central Kyoto and Osaka.
It is not only a commercial center that carries on the traditions of the castle town of Fuishim-jo Castle, but also a commuter town for central Kyoto and Osaka.
sen.cmt: I've deleted "characterized as" because it's quite chokuyaku and makes the sentence seem a bit unnatural.
sen.e: It is not only a commercial center that carries on the traditions of the castle town of Fushimi-jo Castle, but also a commuter town for central Kyoto and Osaka.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 532年（欽明2年） - 欽明天皇、山城国一帯に勢力があった秦大津父を紀郡深草里に探し右腕とする
sen.e: In 532 Emperor Kinmei met HATA no Otsuchi in Fukakusa-no-sato Ki-no-kori, who had control over Yamashiro Province, and appointed him as his right-hand.
In 532, Emperor Kinmei met HATA no Otsuchi, who had control over Yamashiro Province, in Fukakusa-no-sato Ki-no-kori and appointed him as his right-hand man.
sen.cmt: 後半を書き換えました。
sen.e: 532: Emperor Kinmei met HATA no Otsuchi, who had control over Yamashiro Province, in Fukakusa-no-sato Ki-no-kori and appointed him as his right-hand man.

sen.j: 711年（和銅4年） - 秦伊呂具によって深草稲荷神社が創建されるという
sen.e: In 711 HATA no Irogu is said to have founded Fukakusa Inari-jinja Shrine.
In 711 HATA no Irogu is said to have founded Fukakusa Inari-jinja Shrine.
711: HATA no Irogu is said to have founded Fukakusa Inari-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 861年（貞観 (日本)4年） - 藤原北家の藤原良房が貞観寺を創建。
sen.e: In 861 FUJIWARA no Yoshifusa of Fujiwara Hokke (Northern House) founded Jogan-ji Temple.
In 861 FUJIWARA no Yoshifusa of Fujiwara Hokke (Northern House) founded Jogan-ji Temple.
861: FUJIWARA no Yoshifusa of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan founded Jogan-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: "In 861"→"861:"に変更しました。"Fujiwara Hokke (Northern House)"→"the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan"に変更しました。

sen.j: 深草は藤原氏の領地であったとされる
sen.e: Fukakusa is said to have been a territory of Fujiwara clan.
Fukakusa is said to have been a territory of the Fujiwara clan.
Fukakusa is said to have been a territory of the Fujiwara clan.

sen.j: 874年（貞観16年） - 聖宝が上醍醐に一寺を建立、醍醐寺となす
sen.e: In 874 Shobo founded a temple in Kami-Daigo, which was given the name of Daigo-ji Temple.
In 874 Shobo founded a temple in Kami-Daigo, which was given the name of Daigo-ji Temple.
874: Shobo founded a temple in Kami-Daigo, which was given the name of Daigo-ji Temple.

sen.j: 952年（天暦6年） - 醍醐寺の五重塔が建立される
sen.e: In 952 the five-story pagoda of Daigo-ji Temple was built.
In 952 the five-story pagoda of Daigo-ji Temple was built.
952: The five-story pagoda of Daigo-ji Temple was built.

sen.j: 延久年間 - 橘俊綱が伏見山荘を営む
sen.e: TACHIBANA no Toshitsuna built Fushimi Sanso Mountain Villa between 1069 and 1074.
TACHIBANA no Toshitsuna built Fushimi Sanso Mountain Villa between 1069 and 1074.
TACHIBANA no Toshitsuna built Fushimi Sanso Mountain Villa between 1069 and 1074.

sen.j: 1186年（文治2年） - 後白河院が伏見殿御所に移る
sen.e: In 1186 Cloistered Emperor Goshirakawa moved to Fushimi-dono Gosho Imperial Palace.
In 1186 Cloistered Emperor Goshirakawa moved to Fushimi-dono Gosho Imperial Palace.
1186: Cloistered Emperor Goshirakawa moved to Fushimi-dono Gosho Imperial Palace.

sen.j: 1221年（承久3年） - 後鳥羽上皇、伏見城南寺に流鏑馬揃えと称し倒幕の兵を上げる
sen.e: In 1221 retired Emperor Gotoba raised an army at Jonan-ji Temple under the pretext of holding horseback archery game to rebel the Shugunate.
In 1221 retired Emperor Gotoba raised an army at Jonan-ji Temple under the pretext of holding a horseback archery game to rebel the Shogunate.
1221: The Retired Emperor Gotoba raised an army at Jonan-ji Temple in Fushimi under the pretext of holding a horseback archery game to rebel the Shogunate.
sen.cmt: Retired としました。 Fushimi 追加しました。"In 1221 retired"→"1221: The Retired"に変更しました。

sen.j: 貞治年間以降、崇光天皇が伏見山荘を伏見宮栄仁親王代々の相伝地とし伏見宮家が創設
sen.e: Between 1362 to 1368 Emperor Suko established Fushiminomiya family, who inherited Fushimi Sanso Mountain Villa for generations from Prince FUSHIMINOMIYA Yoshihito.
Between 1362 to 1368 Emperor Suko established the Fushiminomiya family, who inherited Fushimi Sanso Mountain Villa for generations from Prince FUSHIMINOMIYA Yoshihito.
1362 to 1368: Emperor Suko established the Fushiminomiya family, who inherited Fushimi Sanso Mountain Villa for generations from Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Yoshihito.
sen.cmt: Fushiminomiya としました。"Between 1362 to 1368"→"1362 to 1368:"に変更しました。

sen.j: 1426年（応永33年） - 丹波猿楽の矢田座が伏見御香宮の楽頭職を得る
sen.e: In 1426 Yata-za of Tanba Sarugaku assumed the post of Gakuto-shiki of Fushimi Gokogu-jinja Shrine.
In 1426 Yata-za of Tanba Sarugaku assumed the post of Gakuto-shiki of Fushimi Gokogu-jinja Shrine.
1426: Yata-za of Tanba Sarugaku (form of theater becoming the basis for Noh) assumed the post of Gakuto-shiki (right to play sarugaku) of Fushimi Gokogu-jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: 猿楽、楽頭職 の補足をしました。"In 1426"→"1426:"に変更しました。

sen.j: 1441年（嘉吉1年） - 伏見など京都近郊の諸村が徳政一揆を起こして洛中に押寄せる
sen.e: In 1441 an uprising occurred in Fushimi and other villages around Kyoto and marched on Rakuchu demanding debt cancellation orders
In 1441 an uprising occurred in Fushimi and other villages around Kyoto which marched on Rakuchu demanding the cancellation of debt
1441: Tokusei uprising occurred in Fushimi and other villages around Kyoto which marched on Rakuchu (inside the capital Kyoto) demanding the cancellation of debt.
sen.cmt: 徳政 を追加しました。洛中の補足をしました。"In 1441"→"1441:"に変更しました。

sen.j: 1594年（文禄3年） - 豊臣秀吉が伏見城の城下町として町割、開発を行ない、町の原型が形作られる（現在も区内に残る地名や鍵状に曲がった道路には城下町の特徴が色濃く表れている）
sen.e: In 1594 Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI built the foundation of a town as the castle town of Fushimi-jo Castel through urban development and zoning. (The distinct features of the castle town can be found today in the place names and hook-shaped roads that still remain in the ward.)

In 1594 Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI built the foundation of the castle town for Fushimi-jo Castle through urban development and zoning. (The distinct features of the castle town can be found today in the place names and hook-shaped roads that still remain in the ward.)

1594: Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI built the foundation of the castle town for Fushimi-jo Castle through urban development and zoning (the distinct features of the castle town can be found today in the place names and hook-shaped roads that still remain in the ward).
sen.cmt: 一つの文章にしました。"In 1594"→"1594:"に変更しました。

sen.j: 1598年（慶長3年） - 豊臣秀吉、醍醐にて花見を行う
sen.e: In 1598 Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI held a cherry blossom viewing party in Daigo.
In 1598 Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI held a cherry blossom viewing party in Daigo.
1598: Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI held a cherry blossom viewing party in Daigo.

sen.j: 1600年（慶長5年） - 伏見城にて激戦が行われ炎上、関ヶ原の戦いの火ぶたが切られる
sen.e: In 1600 a fierce battle occurred in the Fushimi-jo Castle, which triggered the Battle of Sekigahara.
In 1600 a fierce battle occurred in the Fushimi-jo Castle, which triggered the Battle of Sekigahara.
1600: A fierce battle occurred in the Fushimi-jo Castle, which triggered the Battle of Sekigahara.

sen.j: 1601年（慶長6年） - 伏見城下に銀座 (歴史)が置かれる
sen.e: In 1601 a silver mint (history) was established in the castle town of Fushimi.
In 1601 a silver mint (historical) was established in the castle town of Fushimi.
1601: A silver mint (historical) was established in the castle town of Fushimi.

sen.j: 1603年（慶長8年） - 徳川家康、伏見城にて大将軍宣下を受ける
sen.e: In 1603 Ieyasu TOKUGAWA was appointed barbarian-quelling generalissimo in the Fushimi-jo Castle.
In 1603 Ieyasu TOKUGAWA was appointed barbarian-quelling generalissimo in the Fushimi-jo Castle.
1603: Ieyasu TOKUGAWA was appointed taishogun (barbarian-quelling generalissimo) in the Fushimi-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: taishogun を入れました。"In 1603"→"1603:"に変更しました。

sen.j: 1607年（慶長12年） - 松平定勝が伏見城代となる
sen.e: In 1607 Sadakatsu MATSUDAIRA became a chamberlain, castle keeper.
In 1607 Sadakatsu MATSUDAIRA became a chamberlain, castle keeper.
1607: Sadakatsu MATSUDAIRA became a chamberlain, castle keeper.

sen.j: 1608年（慶長13年） - 銀座が京都に移される
sen.e: In 1608 the silver mint was moved to Kyoto.
In 1608 the silver mint was moved to Kyoto.
1608: the silver mint was moved to Kyoto.

sen.j: 1613年（慶長18年） - 京都二条と伏見の間に高瀬川 (京都府)が開通する
sen.e: In 1613 the Takase-gawa River (Kyoto) opened between Kyoto Nijo and Fushimi.
In 1613 the Takase-gawa River (Kyoto) opened between Kyoto Nijo and Fushimi.
1613: The Takase-gawa River (Kyoto Prefecture) opened between Kyoto Nijo and Fushimi.
sen.cmt: 京都府 としました。"In 1613 the"→"1613: The"に変更しました。

sen.j: 1617年（元和 (日本)3年） - 伏見城代が廃止される
sen.e: In 1617 the post of the chamberlain of Fushimi-jo Caslte was abolished.
In 1617 the post of the chamberlain of Fushimi-jo Caslte was abolished.
1617: The post of the chamberlain of Fushimi-jo Castle was abolished.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。"In 1617 the"→"1617: The"に変更しました。

sen.j: 1624年（寛永1年） - 伏見城が廃城となる。
sen.e: In 1624 Fushimi-jo Castle was closed.
In 1624 Fushimi-jo Castle was closed.
1624: Fushimi-jo Castle was closed.

sen.j: 伏見は奉行が支配する
sen.e: Bugyo, a magistrate of shogunate administrators became the ruler of Fushimi.
Bugyo, a magistrate of shogunate administrators became the ruler of Fushimi.
Bugyo, a magistrate of shogunate administrators became the ruler of Fushimi.

sen.j: 1625年（寛永2年） - 松平定綱が淀藩の藩主となる
sen.e: In 1625 Sadatsuna MATSUDAIRA became the domain head of the Yodo clan.
In 1625 Sadatsuna MATSUDAIRA became the domain head of the Yodo clan.
1625: Sadatsuna MATSUDAIRA became the domain head of the Yodo clan.

sen.j: 1694年（元禄7年） - 御香宮神社例祭の芝居・見世物が始まる
sen.e: In 1694 a drama or show first played in the annual festival, of Gokonomiya Jinja Shrine.
In 1694 a drama or show first played in the annual festival of Gokonomiya Jinja Shrine.
1694: A drama or show first played in the annual festival of Gokonomiya Jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 1698年（元禄11年） - 伏見奉行・建部内匠頭、伏見舟200艘の新造を許可
sen.e: In 1698 TATEBE Takuminokami, Fushimi City magistrate permitted the building of 200 Fushimi-bune Ships.
In 1698 TATEBE Takuminokami, Fushimi City magistrate permitted the building of 200 Fushimi-bune Ships.
1698: TATEBE Takuminokami, Fushimi City magistrate permitted the building of 200 Fushimi-bune Ships.

sen.j: 1736年（元文1年） - 伏見指物町の銭座で銭貨が作られる
sen.e: In 1738 coins started to be made in Zeniza, or a mint in Fushimi Sashimono-cho.
In 1738 coins started to be made in Zeniza, or a mint in Fushimi Sashimono-cho.
1736: Coins started to be made in Zeniza, or a mint in Fushimi Sashimono-cho.
sen.cmt: 数字を修正しました。"In 1736 coins"→"1736: Coins"に変更しました。

sen.j: 1785年（天明5年） - 伏見騒動
sen.e: In 1785 Fushimi sodo trouble occurred.
In 1785 Fushimi sodo trouble occurred.
1785: Fushimi sodo trouble occurred.

sen.j: 1786年（天明6年） - 伏見町の人口が4万人を数える
sen.e: In 1786 the population of Fushimi-cho exceeded forty thousand.
In 1786 the population of Fushimi-cho exceeded forty thousand.
1786: The population of Fushimi-cho exceeded forty thousand.

sen.j: 1862年（文久2年） - 寺田屋事件
sen.e: In 1862 Terada-ya Incident occurred.
In 1862 Terada-ya Incident occurred.
1862: Terada-ya Incident occurred.

sen.j: 1864年（元治1年） - 長州藩が兵を率いて伏見に入る（禁門の変）
sen.e: In 1864 soldiers lead by the Choshu clan entered in Fushimi. (Kinmon no Hen, Kinmon Rebellion)
In 1864 soldiers lead by the Choshu clan entered Fushimi. (Kinmon no Hen, Kinmon Rebellion)
1864: Soldiers led by the Choshu clan entered Fushimi. (Kinmon no Hen, Kinmon Rebellion)
sen.cmt: led としました。"In 1864 soldiers"→"1864: Soldiers"に変更しました。

sen.j: 1867年（慶応3年） - 伏見奉行が廃止される
sen.e: In 1867 the ruling by Bugyo came to an end.
In 1867 the ruling by Bugyo came to an end.
1867: The ruling by Bugyo came to an end.

sen.j: 1868年（慶応4年） - 鳥羽・伏見の戦いで伏見城下が戦場となる
sen.e: In 1868 the Fushimi-jo Castle became a battlefield of the Battle of Toba-Fushimi.
In 1868 the Fushimi-jo Castle became a battlefield for the Battle of Toba-Fushimi.
1868: The Fushimi-jo Castle became a battlefield for the Battle of Toba-Fushimi.

sen.j: 1895年（明治28年）2月1日 - 京都駅前（七条）と伏見下油掛の間で、営業用としては日本初の電車である京都電気鉄道開業。
sen.e: On February 1, 1895, Kyoto Electric Railway--Japan's first commercial electric railway-- opened between a square in front of Kyoto Station (Shichijo) and Fushimi-Shimoaburakake.
On February 1, 1895, Kyoto Electric Railway--Japan's first commercial electric railway-- opened between a square in front of Kyoto Station (Shichijo) and Fushimi-Shimoaburakake.
February 1, 1895: Kyoto Electric Railway--Japan's first commercial electric railway-- opened between a square in front of Kyoto Station (Shichijo) and Fushimi-Shimoaburakake.

sen.j: （後の京都市電伏見線、1970年廃止）
sen.e: (It became Kyoto City Trams Fushimi Line in a later year and was out of service in 1970.)
(It became Kyoto City Trams Fushimi Line a later year and was out of service in 1970.)
(It became Kyoto City Trams Fushimi Line a later year and was out of service in 1970.)

sen.j: 1905年（明治38年）7月18日 - 旧大日本帝国陸軍第16師団 (日本軍)が深草に置かれる。
sen.e: On July 18, 1905, the 16th Army Division of now-defunct Imperial Japanese Army was established in Fukakusa.
On July 18, 1905, the 16th Army Division of the now-defunct Imperial Japanese Army was established in Fukakusa.
July 18, 1905: The sixteenth Army Division of the now-defunct Imperial Japanese Army was established in Fukakusa.
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。"On July 18, 1905, the"→"July 18, 1905: The"に変更しました。

sen.j: 1929年（昭和4年）5月1日 - 旧紀伊郡伏見町が市制施行し伏見市が誕生（京都市へ合併前提での市制施行であった）
sen.e: On May 1, 1929, Fushimi-machi Kii District was reorganized as a municipality to become Fushimi City. (The city was reorganized on the premise of merging into Kyoto City.)
On May 1, 1929, Fushimi-machi Kii District was reorganized as a municipality to become Fushimi City. (The city was reorganized on the premise of merging into Kyoto City.)
May 1, 1929: Fushimi-machi, Kii-gun was reorganized as a municipality to become Fushimi City (the city was reorganized on the premise of merging into Kyoto City.)
sen.cmt: kii-gun としました。"On May 1, 1929,"→"May 1, 1929:"に変更しました。

sen.j: 1931年（昭和6年）4月1日 - 伏見市、紀伊郡深草町、下鳥羽村、横大路村、納所村、堀内村、向島村、竹田村、宇治郡醍醐村の1市1町7村が京都市と合併し、伏見区が誕生
sen.e: On April 1, 1931, Fushimi Ward was founded through a merger of a city, a town, and seven villages--Fushimi City, Fukakusa-cho Kii-gun, Shimotoba-mura, Yokooji-mura, Nouso-mura, Horiuchi-mura, Mukaijima-mura, Takeda-mura, and Daigo-mura Uji-gun--into Kyoto City.

On April 1, 1931, Fushimi Ward was founded through a merger of a city, a town, and seven villages--Fushimi City, Fukakusa-cho Kii-gun, Shimotoba-mura, Yokooji-mura, Nouso-mura, Horiuchi-mura, Mukaijima-mura, Takeda-mura, and Daigo-mura Uji-gun--into Kyoto City.

April 1, 1931: Fushimi Ward was founded through a merger of a city, a town, and seven villages--Fushimi City, Fukakusa-cho, Shimotoba-mura, Yokooji-mura, Noso-mura, Horiuchi-mura, Mukaijima-mura, Takeda-mura of Kii-gun, and Daigo-mura of Uji-gun--into Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: 紀伊郡の場所を変更しました。"On April 1, 1931,"→"April 1, 1931:"に変更しました。

sen.j: 1950年（昭和25年）12月1日 - 乙訓郡羽束師村、久我村を編入
sen.e: On December 1, 1950, Hazukashi-mura Otokuni-gun and Koga-mura were merged.
On December 1, 1950, Hazukashi-mura Otokuni-gun and Koga-mura were merged.
December 1, 1950: Hazukashi-mura and Koga-mura of Otokuni-gun were merged.
sen.cmt: 乙訓郡の場所を変更しました。"On December 1, 1950,"→"December 1, 1950:"に変更しました。

sen.j: 1957年（昭和32年）4月1日 - 久世郡淀町を編入
sen.e: On April 1, 1957, Yodo-cho Kuse-gun was merged.
On April 1, 1957, Yodo-cho Kuse-gun was merged.
April 1, 1957: Yodo-cho, Kuse-gun was merged.
sen.cmt: カンマを追加しました。"On April 1, 1957,"→"April 1, 1957:"に変更しました。

sen.j: 1967年（昭和42年） - 伏見港が都市計画決定。
sen.e: In 1967 a city plan project was adopted to close the Fushimi Port.
In 1967 a city plan project was adopted to close the Fushimi Port.
1967: A city plan project was adopted to close the Fushimi Port.

Its history as a port came to an end along with the name of Fushimi Port.

sen.j: 伝統的な日本酒の名産地として知られるほか、先進的なエレクトロニクス産業やそれをサポートする資材製造の事業所が見受けられる。
sen.e: The city is renowned for its traditional breweries of Sake, Japanese liquor, but manufacturers of advanced electronics industries and their supporting material businesses are also found.

The city is renowned for its traditional breweries of Sake, Japanese liquor, but manufacturers of advanced electronics and business involved in materials which support this industry can also be found.

The city is renowned for its traditional breweries of Sake, Japanese liquor, but manufacturers of advanced electronics and business involved in materials which support this industry can also be found.

sen.j: 油小路通（通称新堀川通り）にはパルスプラザ（京都府総合見本市会館）があり、様々な業種による見本市や発表会が頻繁に開催されており、京都の産業を対外的にPRする拠点として重視されている。
sen.e: Pulse Plaza (Kyoto Trade Fair Center) is located along the Abura-koji-dori (also known as Shinhorikawa-dori) --it is an important site for external public relations activities for informing the public of industries of Kyoto and exhibitions are frequently held by a wide variety of industries.

Pulse Plaza (Kyoto Trade Fair Center) is located along the Abura-koji-dori (also known as Shinhorikawa-dori) --it is an important site for public relations activities for informing the public of Kyoto's industries and exhibitions are frequently held by a wide variety of industries.

sen.e: Yoshimurasyuzo Co., Ltd., which is said to be a descendent of Yoshimura family--a cultivator of the Fushimi Castle site--moved its headquarters to Shin-onsen-cho Hyogo Prefecture.

sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。年号を追加しました。

sen.j: 京阪沿線・近鉄沿線・地下鉄沿線では商店街や大型店が存在し、おおむね活況を呈しているといえる。
sen.e: In regions along the Keihan Line, Kintetsu Line, and subway, streets are lined with stores and large retailers presenting lively atmosphere.
In regions along the Keihan Line, Kintetsu Line, and subway, streets are lined with stores and large retailers which create a lively atmosphere.
In regions along the Keihan Line, Kintetsu Line, and subway, streets are lined with stores and large retailers which create a lively atmosphere.

sen.j: 伝統的な小規模の店舗は京阪沿線に多い。
sen.e: Many traditional retailers are found in regions along the Keihan Line.
Many traditional retailers are found in regions along the Keihan Line.
Many traditional retailers are found in regions along the Keihan Line.

sen.j: 電車通学生が多いことから、アパート仲介など学生相手の商業も盛んである。
sen.e: Businesses of many retail estate agencies that intermediate between students and land loads of apartments are prosperous, because many students go to universities along the railways.
Many retail estate agencies that act as intermediates between students and apartment landlords have succeeded due to the large number of students who commute to universities along the railways.
Many retail estate agencies that act as intermediates between students and apartment landlords have succeeded due to the large number of students who commute to universities along the railways.

sen.j: 国道1号線や新堀川通沿いには郊外型の大規模小売店、飲食店や娯楽場が並んでいる。
sen.e: The national Highway Route No. 1 and the Shinhorikawa-dori Street are lined with large suburban retail stores, restaurants, and amusement centers.
The national Highway Route No. 1 and the Shinhorikawa-dori Street are lined with large suburban retail stores, restaurants, and amusement centers.
The National Route 1 and the Shinhorikawa-dori Street are lined with large suburban retail stores, restaurants, and amusement centers.
sen.cmt: 国道→national route としました。

sen.j: 区の南西部においては商業基盤が弱い。
sen.e: The the southwestern part of the ward has not a solid business foundation.
Business in the southwestern part of the ward is relatively weak.
Business in the southwestern part of the ward is relatively weak.

sen.j: 公共交通が不便な代わり道路の便は良い方なので、自動車に乗って周辺地域の大型店を利用するスタイルが定着している模様。
sen.e: Because the area has not efficient public transportation service but well-developed road service, a style of shopping--driving to large shopping centers in peripheral areas seems to be established.
Due to the lack of efficient public transportation, driving to large shopping centers in surrounding areas has become the norm as a result of well developed road service.
Due to the lack of efficient public transportation, driving to large shopping centers in surrounding areas has become the norm as a result of well developed road service.

tit.cmt: 小タイトル用に変更しました。

sen.j: 伏見区は、全国の政令指定都市の中で、横浜市港北区、横浜市青葉区 (横浜市)に次いで人口の多い区である（東京特別区を除く）。
sen.e: Fushimi Ward is the most populated of ordinance-designated citeis (excluding Tokyo Special Ward) following Kohoku Ward Yokohama City and Aoba Ward Yokohama City (Yokohama City).
Fushimi Ward is the most populated of ordinance-designated cities (excluding Tokyo Special Ward) following Kohoku Ward Yokohama City and Aoba Ward Yokohama City (Yokohama City).
Fushimi Ward is the most populated of ordinance-designated cities (excluding Tokyo Special Ward) following Kohoku Ward, Yokohama City and Aoba Ward, Yokohama City (Yokohama City).
sen.cmt: カンマを追加しました。

sen.j: そのため、昔から分区構想が出ては消えている。
sen.e: Therefore, the plan of separating the ward has kept coming up and disappearing for some time.

sen.j: 現在、伏見区には深草支所、醍醐支所、神川出張所、淀出張所があるが、主な分区構想は、このうち深草支所と醍醐支所を伏見区から分離させるものである。
sen.e: The Fushimi Ward office has the Fukakusa Branch, the Daigo Branch, the Kamikawa Branch Office, and the Yodo Branch Office, but a separation of the areas of the Fukakusa Branch and Daigo Branch from Fushimi Ward has been proposed.

The Fushimi Ward office has the Fukakusa Branch, the Daigo Branch, the Kamikawa Branch Office, and the Yodo Branch Office. However it has been proposed that the Fukakusa Branch and Daigo Branch be separated from Fushimi Ward.

The Fushimi Ward office has the Fukakusa Branch, the Daigo Branch, the Kamikawa Branch Office, and the Yodo Branch Office; however it has been proposed that the Fukakusa Branch and Daigo Branch be separated from Fushimi Ward.
sen.cmt: 一つの文章につなげました。

sen.j: しかし、深草支所管内、醍醐支所管内とも人口は10万人にも満たない（それでも東山区よりは人口が多い）ほか、深草支所管内と醍醐支所管内は接してはいるものの地域的な結びつきは希薄であることが、分区の機運が盛り上がらない要因の1つとなっている。
sen.e: However, the populations of both the Fukakusa Branch and the Daigo Branch are less than 10 thousands (still larger than Higashiyama Ward's) and, in addition, the two areas share a border geographically but have not had strong ties on a community level--these lie behind the fact that the separation plan has not gained momentum.

However, the populations of both the Fukakusa Branch and the Daigo Branch are less than 10 thousand (still larger than Higashiyama Ward's) and, additionally, the two areas share a geographical border but have not had strong ties on a community level--these lie behind the fact that the separation plan has not gained momentum.

However, the populations of both the Fukakusa Branch and the Daigo Branch are less than 100 thousand (still larger than Higashiyama Ward's) and, additionally, the two areas share a geographical border but have not had strong ties on a community level--these lie behind the fact that the separation plan has not gained momentum.

sen.j: 現在の醍醐支所管内は伏見区中心部よりも山科区との結びつきの方が圧倒的に強く、醍醐支所を分離して山科区と併合する方が合理的とする考え方もある。
sen.e: Some consider it more reasonably that the area of the Gosho Branch be separated From Fushimi Ward and merged with Yamashina Ward because the area has far closer ties with Yamashina Ward than the central part of Fushimi Ward.

Some consider it more reasonable that the area of the Gosho Branch be separated From Fushimi Ward and merged with Yamashina Ward because the area has far closer ties with Yamashina Ward than the central part of Fushimi Ward.

Some consider it more reasonable that the area of the Daigo Branch be separated From Fushimi Ward and merged with Yamashina Ward because the area has far closer ties with Yamashina Ward than the central part of Fushimi Ward.
